newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Motorola to launch Indonesia data network.
newsitem.headline: Motorola to launch Indonesia data network.

text.p: Motorola Wireless Data Group on Monday announced an agreement with Indonesia's first wireless data network operator PT Elektrindo Nusantara to provide a country-wide system for two-way mobile data communications.

Motorola said in a statement the agreement came after the Department of Tourism, Post and Telecommunications granted Elektrindo Nusantara a license to operate a nationwide packet data wireless communications system.
The firms will operate the wireless Data TAC 5000 system which is suitable for a range of data transfer applications for commerical operations, including retailing and electronic-mail.
The statement said the system will commence operations in Indonesia during the first quarter in 1997, beginning with the deployment of 40 base stations throughtout the Jakarta metropolitan region.
The system will then expand to Bali, Batam, Medan, Semarang, Surabaya, West Java, Yogyakarta and other regions, it said.
